results.title: Cook's First Journey
results.brief_description:
This film depicts Captain Cook sailing and discovering new lands, meeting the natives and subsequently returning home.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Cooee
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Geoffrey Barnes and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: In 1915, the Australian Land Army marched on the Cooee trail from the mid-western farming town of Gilgandra to Sydney, gathering volunteer troops for the Dardanelles on the way. In 1987, a new band of “Cooees” set off to re-enact the march. The film’s production crew were involved from the march’s planning stage. This record of the re-enactment covering the 550 km from Gilgandra to the Sydney Town Hall not only provides a portrait of the individuals involved but also gives a glimpse of the mood and attitudes of rural Australia, 1987.

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Richard Mudford
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Convention of Yanmar Overseas Agents, 1964
results.brief_description:
Convention held in Japan for overseas agents of the company Yanmar, founded by Magokichi Yamaoka. Shows the delegates involved in various activities including a visit to the factory, a bus trip to a memorial for the founder, group conference and discussion, social evening event, presentation of awards, a golf day, and the final gathering before departure.
Silent film - no credits available.

results.title: Controversy over the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Presents the controversy concerning the geological make-up of the moon - specifically the origin of large lunar craters. Two eminent scientists interpret the same available data and discuss reasons for their divergent views. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Controlling quality is everybody's business
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Wallace J. Richardson
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a sound working knowledge of the principles of effective quality control, and how these may be applied. The film also dramatises the importance of maintaining good quality, and shows how everyone can help.

results.title: Controlled photographic lighting
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the three basic considerations in controlled photographic lighting: placement of lights, quality of light and lighting ratio. Shows the functions of main, fill, background and accent lights.

results.title: Controlled heat
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Douglas Clarke and Jack Chambers
results.brief_description: By means of diagrams and photography tells the story of thermostatic control. Shows, in fact, how the expansion of metals when heated can be used to regulate temperatures. The story is treated historically, beginning in the 18th century with the problem of accurate time-keeping, especially for navigation, and leading up to such complicated modern examples as open-hearth steel processing.

results.title: Controlled forces
results.brief_description: “Summary: translated from the German. original title- kontrollierte kraefte- eine dokumentation der suspa . describes suspa’s post-tensioning method whereby high tensile steel wires are installed in the building unit, and stressed with hydraulic jacks, after the concrete has hardened to impart maximum load-bearing capacity. shows the suspa factory in the rhineland and the pre- fabrication of tendons. the quality control standards (elongation tests, ultimate tensile tests, fatigue tests), are also illustrated. this bbrv method is able to be used in all branches of civil engineering”
